nodes.text: the combination of uncertainty of execution and long delay is arguably  cruel.
This court wouldn't have recognized that the combination of execution and long delay can be cruel unless it was arguable that it is.
This Court has recognized that such a combination can inflict  horri- ble feelings   and  an immense mental anxiety amounting to a great increase of the offender 's punishment.
Courts of other nations wouldn't have accepted that delays of 15 years or less can render capital punushment degrading shocking or cruel unless it was arguable that such delays are cruel.
Courts of other nations have found that delays of 15 years or less can render capital punishment degradingshockingor cruel.

the Supreme Court of Canada recently held that the potential for lengthy incar- ceration before execution is  a relevant consideration   when determining whether extradition to the United States violates principles of  fundamental justice.

The Supreme Court of Canada wouldn't have held that the potential for lengthy incarceration before execution is a relevant consideration when determining whether extradition to the US violates principles of fundamental justice unless it was arguable that such incarceration was cruel.
